content: [aleo] "After how many you just put down? Even those creatures must know when they're beaten."
[aleo] "A girl leads those who saved us from...those things?"
[aleo] "Between losing so many clansmen and this, I feel...I'm not myself. I thank you, child."
[aleo] "But Boersgard is the only other place I've seen in my life - this is all my family knows. Are things really as tragic as you're making them sound?"
[aleo] "But if Bellower is nearby, we all should know."
[aleo] "But my children...you don't understa--"
[aleo] "Do you have any idea what might be causing the deep rumbling underfoot?"
[aleo $hero] "Ah, names destined for history."
[aleo] "History indeed! Sundr-Slayers here among us. Depths! There's so many questions to ask."
[aleo] "I am Aleo, the skald. And your name?"
[aleo] "I'll even make them rhyme, given the time."
[aleo] "Leave? Not to sound ungrateful, but this place...it's all we have. It's our home."
[aleo] "Leave? Not to sound ungrateful, but this place...it's all we have. It's our home."

content.option: "I felt the same when Skogr was overrun."
"Your home is about to be destroyed by dredge."
"Fine, but no one else will come to save you."

content: /=Aleo looks at Iver.=/
/=Aleo looks back and forth between you and Iver before nodding.=/
/=Aleo looks shocked and confused.=/
/=Aleo looks skeptical.=/
[aleo] "Packing and tending to our dead will take some time, but I'll have everyone on the ships soon."
/=Aleo pauses and looks to Iver who confirms your statement with a nod.=/
[aleo] "Perhaps."
[aleo] She's incredibly composed for someone so young - I think I see why you follow her."
/=Aleo takes a step back before lowering his head.=/
[aleo] "Tell me: did you just come from Boersgard? We heard rumor the Sundr Bellower was sacking the town."
[aleo] "Tell me: did you just come from Boersgard? We heard rumor the Sundr Bellower was sacking the town."

content.option: "Talking about Sundr will only make people panic."
"We should leave before the dredge regroup."

content: [aleo] "The Serpent in the sun, Radormyr? I'm no holy man, but joking about dead gods feels wrong."
/= The villagers' reactions range from terrified by the foes to awestruck at your arrival. Their leader approaches and bows in front of Iver.=/
[aleo] "Your timing makes me think the gods have returned! Please, I--"
/=He is one of the giants known as varl and has fought dredge in the northern winters, personally killed one of their generals - the Sundr Raze - and lost an arm to the Sundr Bellower.=/
[$hero] "Alette, and this is Iver."
[$hero] "Deep rumbling?"
[$hero] "Even if it did, it's not like it would change anything."
[$hero] "Funny. Anyway, we should all leave before the dredge regroup."
[$hero] "I don't think the Sun Serpent would break mountains and try to swallow us all."
[$hero] "I know exactly what it means to be a child stripped from your home. And family!"
[$hero] "It's not the first time you've been called a hero, /=Yngvar=/."
[$hero iver] "Iver..."
[$hero] "So what if it crushes me? Maybe I don't care anymore!"
[$hero] "The dredge have your people ready to fight, but Sundr attacks? It might scare that out of them."
[$hero] "They'll have to wait until we're all safely back on the longships and leaving this place."
[$hero] "We've almost never seen them stop. And no one knows why they push on so hard."
/=He stops when Iver nods his head towards you. The man peers under your hood.=/
/=He turns to leave but stops.=/
/=He walks towards the village, leaving you alone with your thoughts.=/
/=He whips his cloak back with a flourish.=/
/=His smile seems genuine - as much as the concern that follows.=/
[iver aleo] "A topic for another time, skald. Maybe."
[iver aleo] "Probably worse."
[iver] "'Happy Humans' I used to call them. She made him smile; he made her laugh."
[iver $hero] "Could be that giant Serpent again."
[iver $hero] "Except we had the sense to leave while we were able."
[iver $hero] "Fine. But they'll need your strength more than they'll ever need mine."
[iver $hero] "I'm not sure you /=do=/ let go. You just keep going."
[iver $hero] "Just don't let whatever it is inside build up. It can crush you."
[iver $hero] "Leading this group isn't easy, but Rook knew you could do it if you had to. And I'm telling you - you have to."
[iver $hero] "Moves his hands too much when he talks. It's unsettling."
[iver $hero] "No doubt Oddleif could help more with that than a fatherless, loveless varl like me."
[iver $hero] "People thinking we're heroes now? The world is breaking in more ways than one."
[iver $hero] "She ordered us to land. And those /=things=/ are dredge, like the ones you probably heard about as a kid."
[iver $hero] "Sorry. I'm sure thinking about losing one parent is hard enough."
[iver $hero] "Sorry. I'm sure thinking about losing one parent is hard enough."

content.option: "I like hearing how they were together."
"Maybe I could ask you more about them later?"

content: [iver $hero] "Sounds like the brave poet is going to use us in a few proper verses."
[iver $hero] "We don't know much about them at all."
[iver $hero] "What did I tell you?"
[iver $hero] "Yeah, I keep thinking this is one of Rook's pranks like when he made your mother think he had the plague."
[iver $hero] "You can't afford to act like that. Losing Rook was hard on us all, but you - more than any of us - need to face that pain or it'll crush you."
[iver $hero] "Your father gave everything to get us this far. Don't waste that."
[iver $hero] "Your humor reminds me of your father's - since we're talking about things we'd rather avoid."
[iver $hero] "Your humor reminds me of your father's - since we're talking about things we'd rather avoid."

content.option: "I just keep hoping I'll wake up and see my dad again."
"I know he's gone, but I don't know how to let him go."
"You can't make me talk about him if I don't want to!"
"The clansmen could use your strength in packing the ships."

content: [iver] "I never was good at giving advice, so I'll just say this: However you're feeling, you're not alone. But that doesn't change the fact that this caravan is counting on you to take charge."
/=Iver nudges you.=/
[iver] "Of course. Makes me feel like I'm still good for something."
[iver] "Rook was the closest thing I had to a friend. I wish I would've done more to protect him."
/=Iver's smile fades when he sees your face.=/
/=Iver's words begin to sink in. He places his large hand on your shoulder.=/
[iver] "Who could say with the sun stopped in the sky like it is?"
[iver] "You look so much like her when you smile. The entire caravan seems to enjoy it too."
/=Iver, your father's closest friend, looks unamused.=/
{skip} mark1=$hero mark4=aleo mark3=iver
/=The giant stares down at you for a long moment.=/
/=The skald looks around at the small huts of his village.=/
/=The skald nods his understanding but another question creases his brow.=/
/=You look up to see Iver staring off in the distance.=/
/=You smile but say nothing.=/
/=You suddenly hear the centuries of life in Iver's voice and imagine all he has seen.=/
/=You watch Aleo rejoin his family.=/
